title: Asia's first half crude oil imports slip, undermining bullish forecasts
keypoints: Asia's crude oil imports for the first half of the year have declined
This decline undermines previously bullish forecasts for the region
The slip in imports could impact global oil demand and market expectations

title: August Natural Gas Futures Dragged Below $2.500 Amid Higher Production, Milder Weather Forecasts — MidDay ...
keypoints: August natural gas futures fell below key support due to higher production and milder weather forecasts.
Lower 48 gas production rose to 102 Bcf/d, the highest level since March 11.
Category 4 Hurricane Beryl may avoid a direct strike on the Lower 48.
Cooling degree days dropped by 6.5, equating to 10.4 Bcf lower demand.
Freeport LNG terminal's Train 2 experienced a brief outage but flows have bounced back.
U.S. LNG feed gas demand climbed to about 12.9 Bcf/d.
Lower 48 gas production volatility expected at the start of the month.
Henry Hub spot prices lower at $2.205.
Mountain Valley Pipeline LLC began firm transport service, impacting Southeast prices.

title: US natural gas prices ease - Markets
keypoints: US natural gas futures eased about 1% to a six-week low on rising output and forecasts for less demand.
Ongoing oversupply of gas in storage contributed to the price decline.
A federal judge blocked the Biden administration from pausing the approval of applications to export liquefied natural gas (LNG).
Peak demand in Texas was expected to come close to but not break the record for July due to a heat wave.
Next-day gas prices at the Waha hub in West Texas plunged by about 123% to negative 52 cents per mmBtu due to pipeline constraints.
Hurricane Beryl was expected to hit Jamaica and Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula, impacting the market outlook.

title: Selling Continues for Natural Gas Futures; California Cash Down Sharply Despite Heat — MidDay Market Snapshot
keypoints: August natural gas futures continue to decline due to cooler weather forecasts and weaker cash prices.
August Nymex natural gas futures fell by 3.9 cents to $2.439/MMBtu.
A federal court in Louisiana ordered the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) to lift an LNG permit pause, affecting the back of the curve.
Natural gas futures were lower after Freeport LNG confirmed a slow restart following damage from Hurricane Beryl.
Market sentiment remains bearish with expectations of further price declines due to seasonal heavy storage injections and resilient supply.

title: Rystad Energy: Bullish market fundamentals are the main contributing factor to higher global oil prices
keypoints: Strong market fundamentals are pushing oil prices higher, with four consecutive weeks of increases.
Lower crude exports from OPEC and Russia, alongside ramping refinery runs, are contributing to a tighter market.
Expectations of forthcoming interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve are adding to the upward pressure on oil prices.
Brent prices increased by more than 6% in June, continuing a similar trend into July.
US oil production forecasts have been significantly lowered from August onwards, particularly affecting Permian oil output.
The downward adjustment in US oil production is bullish for Brent prices and supports a narrowing of the WTI-Brent spread.
OPEC+ crude exports declined in June, which could indicate greater compliance with production cuts.
Russia's seaborne crude flows dropped significantly in late June, contributing to the tighter global crude market.
Global refinery runs are expected to increase from 83.1 million bpd in June to 84.4 million bpd in August, supporting higher crude prices.
US inflation data showed a further easing, impacting Federal Reserve's rate-setting decisions.

title: US natural gas prices fall - Markets
keypoints: US natural gas futures held near a seven-week low, waiting for direction from a bullish federal report.
Heat wave expected to increase demand for gas for electricity generation.
Smaller-than-usual storage builds due to earlier production cuts after price drops.
Recent weeks saw some producers, like EQT and Chesapeake Energy, resuming production due to higher prices.
Forecast of US utilities adding 32 billion cubic feet of gas into storage for the week ended June 28.
Front-month gas futures for August rose slightly, while September futures jumped to a record premium.
Next-day gas prices at the Waha hub in West Texas fell into negative territory due to pipeline constraints.
Gas output in the Lower 48 US states increased in July.

title: Natural Gas Futures Drift Lower After Light EIA Storage Print; Cash Weaker — MidDay Market Snapshot
keypoints: August natural gas futures were on track for their seventh straight loss after a light weekly storage injection.
EIA reported a seasonally light build of 32 Bcf for the week ending June 28.
Bearish revision to the previous week's storage data.
Natural gas futures dropped as Freeport LNG confirmed a slow restart after damage from Hurricane Beryl.
Market looked past the impact of 'Hurricane From Hell' leading to a temporary rise in natural gas futures.
Prompt-month natural gas futures dropped after a heavy weekly storage injection.
Western cash prices were positive amid extreme heat, though futures showed a narrowing loss.
Heat forecasts were revised, leading to a drop in futures, despite initial higher trading.
